searchDocs.title: Remarks​
searchDocs.content: The ratio is computed using absolute values. Product A made a profit of $200, and product B has a loss of $300. In total, the company lost $100 ($200 – $300). Product A has a weight of: abs(200) / ( abs(200) + abs(-300) ) * 100% = 40% Product B has a weight of: abs(-300) / ( abs(200) + abs(-300) ) * 100% = 60% Product A and product B have respectively a weight of 40% and 60% in the formation of the overall total loss of $100.  We don't compute the ratio for non-finite values. In this case, we return the original non-finite value.  If the sum of the group values is 0, each ratio is considered 0.

searchDocs.title: min​
searchDocs.content: min: number  Custom minInterval for the domain which will affect data bin size.min: NaN or max: NaN can be used for either or both extrema, when unbounded. The minInterval cannot be greater than the computed minimum interval between any two adjacent data points. Further, if you specify a custom numeric minInterval for a time-series, please note that due to the restriction above, the specified numeric minInterval will be interpreted as a fixed interval. This means that, for example, if you have yearly time-series data that ranges from 2016 to 2019 and you manually compute the interval between 2016 and 2017, you'll have 366 days due to 2016 being a leap year. This will not be a valid interval because it is greater than the computed minInterval of 365 days between the other years.  Source​  packages/charts/src/chart_types/xy_chart/utils/specs.ts:275

searchDocs.title: Domain​
searchDocs.content: Domain: "domain"  Raw value in the domain space.  Example:  If your domain is [20, 40] and your padding value is 10. The resulting domain would be [10, 50]

searchDocs.title: DomainRatio​
searchDocs.content: DomainRatio: "domainRatio"  Ratio of total domain relative to domain space  Example:  If your domain is [20, 40] and your padding value is 0.1. The resulting padding would be 2 (i.e. 0.1 * (40 - 20)) resulting in a domain of [18, 42]

searchDocs.title: Pixel​
searchDocs.content: Pixel: "pixel"  Spatial pixel value (aka screenspace) not dependent on domain.

searchDocs.title: Average​
searchDocs.content: Average: "average"  Average between the closest non-null values  Example​  [2, null, null, 8] => [2, 5, 5, 8]

searchDocs.title: Carry​
searchDocs.content: Carry: "carry"  Use the previous non-null value  Remarks​  This is the opposite of Fit.Lookahead  Example​  [2, null, null, 8] => [2, 2, 2, 8]

searchDocs.title: Explicit​
searchDocs.content: Explicit: "explicit"  Specify an explicit value X  Example​  [2, null, null, 8] => [2, X, X, 8]

searchDocs.title: Linear​
searchDocs.content: Linear: "linear"  Linear interpolation between the closest non-null values  Example​  [2, null, null, 8] => [2, 4, 6, 8]

searchDocs.title: Lookahead​
searchDocs.content: Lookahead: "lookahead"  Use the next non-null value  Remarks​  This is the opposite of Fit.Carry  Example​  [2, null, null, 8] => [2, 8, 8, 8]

searchDocs.title: Nearest​
searchDocs.content: Nearest: "nearest"  Use the closest non-null value (before or after)  Example​  [2, null, null, 8] => [2, 2, 8, 8]

searchDocs.title: None​
searchDocs.content: None: "none"  Don't draw value on the graph. Slices out area between null values.  Example​  [2, null, null, 8] => [2, null null, 8]

searchDocs.title: Zero​
searchDocs.content: Zero: "zero"  Sets all null values to 0  Example​  [2, null, null, 8] => [2, 0, 0, 8]

searchDocs.title: Far​
searchDocs.content: Far: "far"  Aligns to far side of axis depending on position  Examples:  Left Axis, Far will push the label to the Left, far from the axisRight Axis, Far will push the axis labels to the RightTop/Bottom Axes, Far will default to Center

searchDocs.title: Near​
searchDocs.content: Near: "near"  Aligns to near side of axis depending on position  Examples:  Left Axis, Near will push the label to the Right, near the axisRight Axis, Near will push the axis labels to the LeftTop/Bottom Axes, Near will default to Center

searchDocs.title: Key​
searchDocs.content: Key: "key"  Highlight all identically named (labelled) items, no matter where they are

searchDocs.title: KeyInLayer​
searchDocs.content: KeyInLayer: "keyInLayer"  Highlight all identically named (labelled) items within the tree layer (depth or ring) of the specific node(s) that the legend item stands for

searchDocs.title: Node​
searchDocs.content: Node: "node"  Highlight the specific node(s) that the legend item stands for.

searchDocs.title: NodeWithDescendants​
searchDocs.content: NodeWithDescendants: "nodeWithDescendants"  Highlight the specific node(s) that the legend item stands for, plus all descendants

searchDocs.title: Path​
searchDocs.content: Path: "path"  Highlight members of the exact path; ie. like Node, plus all its ancestors

searchDocs.title: PathWithDescendants​
searchDocs.content: PathWithDescendants: "pathWithDescendants"  Highlight the specific node(s) that the legend item stands for, plus all ancestors and descendants

searchDocs.title: Average​
searchDocs.content: Average: "average"  Average value considering all data points in the chart

searchDocs.title: Count​
searchDocs.content: Count: "count"  number of data points plotted in the chart

searchDocs.title: CurrentAndLastValue​
searchDocs.content: CurrentAndLastValue: "currentAndLastValue"  Value of the bucket being hovered or last bucket value when not hovering.

searchDocs.title: Difference​
searchDocs.content: Difference: "difference"  Difference between first and last values

searchDocs.title: DifferencePercent​
searchDocs.content: DifferencePercent: "differencePercent"  % difference between first and last values

searchDocs.title: DistinctCount​
searchDocs.content: DistinctCount: "distinctCount"  number of data points with different values plotted in the chart

searchDocs.title: FirstValue​
searchDocs.content: FirstValue: "firstValue"  First value considering all data points in the chart

searchDocs.title: LastValue​
searchDocs.content: LastValue: "lastValue"  Last value considering all data points in the chart

searchDocs.title: Max​
searchDocs.content: Max: "max"  Maximum value considering all data points in the chart

searchDocs.title: Median​
searchDocs.content: Median: "median"  Median value considering all data points in the chart

searchDocs.title: Min​
searchDocs.content: Min: "min"  Minimum value considering all data points in the chart

searchDocs.title: Percent​
searchDocs.content: Percent: "percent"  Partition section value in percent

searchDocs.title: Range​
searchDocs.content: Range: "range"  Difference between min and max values

searchDocs.title: StdDeviation​
searchDocs.content: StdDeviation: "stdDeviation"  Standard deviation of all data points plotted in the chart

searchDocs.title: Total​
searchDocs.content: Total: "total"  Sum of al values plotted in the chart

searchDocs.title: Variance​
searchDocs.content: Variance: "variance"  Variance of all data points plotted in the chart

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: The whole @elastic/charts library starts with the Chart component.

searchDocs.title: size​
searchDocs.content: Type: size?: ChartSizeDefault: '100%'  Sets the size of the chart.  Examples:  200 - Sets width and height to 200px'90%' - Sets width and height to 90% of parent['100%', 200] - Sets width to 100% of parent and height to 200px{ width: '100%', height: 200 } - Sets width to 100% of parent and height to 200px

searchDocs.title: id​
searchDocs.content: Type: id?: stringDefault: a random UUID via uuid  A unique id to indetify the chart. Used to renerate individual chart state.

searchDocs.title: title​
searchDocs.content: Type: title?: string  Top-level title of the chart.

searchDocs.title: description​
searchDocs.content: Type: description?: string  Top-level description of the chart.

searchDocs.title: children​
searchDocs.content: Type: children?: ReactNode  The children specs defining the chart.  In @elastic/charts we configure the chart using a react component api, we call these configuration components specs. Theses specs are applied as children of the Chart element.  While technically children are optional, passing no children will simply return an empty chart.

searchDocs.title: className​
searchDocs.content: Type: className?: string  Adds className to .echChartContent element for custom styling.  warning Careful adding too many styles, as this can lead to unexpected apperance and behaviour of the chart.

searchDocs.title: renderer​
searchDocs.content: Type: renderer?: 'svg' | 'canvas'Default: 'canvas'  This sets the renderer type of the chart.  info Currently this option not configurable per chart as there is not a parrallel renderer for all charts.

searchDocs.title: Compatible Specs​
searchDocs.content: BulletGraph is a standalone spec and cannot be combined with other specs except the Settings specs.

searchDocs.title: Props​
searchDocs.content: All props can be found via BulletGraphProps type.

searchDocs.title: Compatible Specs​
searchDocs.content: GroupBy goes hand-in-hand with SmallMultiples spec to define a faceted chart.  Supported chart types include:  All Cartesian/XY Charts AreaSeriesLineSeriesBarSeriesBubbleSeriesHistogramBarSeries Partition ChartsHeatmap Charts

searchDocs.title: Props​
searchDocs.content: All props can be found via GroupByProps type.

searchDocs.title: by​
searchDocs.content: Type: by: GroupByAccessor<D>  Function to return a unique value by which to group the data

searchDocs.title: sort​
searchDocs.content: Type: sort: GroupBySort  Sort predicate used to sort grouped data

searchDocs.title: format​
searchDocs.content: Type: format?: GroupByFormatter<D>  Formatter used on all by values.  info Only for displayed values, not used in sorting or other internal computations.

searchDocs.title: Compatible Specs​
searchDocs.content: SmallMultiples goes hand-in-hand with GroupBy spec to define a faceted chart.  Supported chart types include:  All Cartesian/XY Charts AreaSeriesLineSeriesBarSeriesBubbleSeriesHistogramBarSeries Partition ChartsHeatmap Charts

searchDocs.title: Props​
searchDocs.content: All props can be found via GroupByProps type.

searchDocs.title: splitHorizontally​
searchDocs.content: Type: splitHorizontally?: string  Identifies the <GroupBy id="foo"> referenced by splitHorizontally="foo", specifying horizontal tiling.

searchDocs.title: splitVertically​
searchDocs.content: Type: splitVertically?: string  Identifies the <GroupBy id="bar"> referenced by splitVertically="bar", specifying vertical tiling.

searchDocs.title: splitZigzag​
searchDocs.content: Type: splitZigzag?: string  Identifies the <GroupBy id="baz"> referenced by splitVertically="baz", specifying space-filling tiling in a Z pattern.

searchDocs.title: style​
searchDocs.content: Type: style?: Partial<SmallMultiplesStyle>  Specifies styling and layout properties of the tiling, such as paddings between and outside panels.

searchDocs.title: Compatible Specs​
searchDocs.content: Tooltip is available for all charts excluding Metric and Wordcloud.

searchDocs.title: Props​
searchDocs.content: All props can be found via GroupByProps type.

searchDocs.title: type​
searchDocs.content: Type: type: TooltipTypeDefault: TooltipType.Vertical  The type of the tooltip

searchDocs.title: snap​
searchDocs.content: Type: snap: booleanDefault: true  Whenever the tooltip needs to snap to the x/band position or not

searchDocs.title: headerFormatter​
searchDocs.content: Type: headerFormatter?: TooltipHeaderFormatter<D>  A formatter for the header value. Ignored when header is defined.

searchDocs.title: unit​
searchDocs.content: Type: unit?: stringTag: @alpha  Unit for event (i.e. time, feet, count, etc.).

searchDocs.title: customTooltip​
searchDocs.content: Type: customTooltip?: CustomTooltip<D, SI>  Render custom tooltip given header and values.

searchDocs.title: stickTo​
searchDocs.content: Type: stickTo?: TooltipStickToDefault: mousePosition  Stick the tooltip to a specific position within the current cursor

searchDocs.title: showNullValues​
searchDocs.content: Type: showNullValues: booleanDefault: false  Show null values on the tooltip

searchDocs.title: header​
searchDocs.content: Type: header: 'default' | 'none' | ComponentType<{ items: TooltipValue<D, SI>[]; header: PointerValue<D> | null }>  Custom header for tooltip. Ignored when used with customTooltip.  note This is not the table headers but spans the entire tooltip.

searchDocs.title: body​
searchDocs.content: Type: body: 'default' | 'none' | ComponentType<{ items: TooltipValue<D, SI>[]; header: PointerValue<D> | null }>  Custom body for tooltip. Ignored when used with customTooltip.  note This is not the table body but spans the entire tooltip.

searchDocs.title: footer​

searchDocs.title: minBrushDelta​
searchDocs.content: Type: minBrushDelta?: numberDefault: 2  The minimum number of pixel to consider for a valid brush event (in both axis if brushAxis prop is BrushAxis.Both). For example: a min value of 2 means that the brush area needs to be at least 2 pixel wide and 2 pixel tall.

searchDocs.title: roundHistogramBrushValues​
searchDocs.content: Type: roundHistogramBrushValues?: booleanDefault: false  Boolean to round brushed values to nearest step bounds.  For example a brush selection range of [1.23, 3.6] with a domain of [1, 2, 3, 4].  when true returns [1, 3]when false returns [1.23, 3.6]

searchDocs.title: allowBrushingLastHistogramBin​
searchDocs.content: Type: allowBrushingLastHistogramBin: booleanDefault: true  Boolean to allow brushing on last bucket even when outside domain or limit to end of domain.  For example a brush selection range of [1.23, 3.6] with a domain of [1, 2, 3]  when true returns [1.23, 3.6]when false returns [1.23, 3]  info Only applies to histogram charts

searchDocs.title: The Chart is not rendering​
searchDocs.content: If you have a Chart defined on your page and you see an empty div class="echContainer"></div> element you are likely missing the css.  https://github.com/elastic/elastic-charts/wiki/Consuming-@elastic-charts#importing-css
